text:
Problem in child.c::winnt_accept()

I ran the binary release of apache 2.0.43 on a PC/Win XP Pro and having a 
internet bridge WinRoutePro 4.2.1
It loops into the winnt_accept routine with the WSAENOTSOCK error and the 
message "AcceptEx failed. Attempting to recover."
I did try the 2.0.44-dev patch on that particular routine and this just change 
the error log but still looping inside. Always WSAENOTSOCK but "winnt_accept: 
AcceptEx failed due to early client" log message.

In another computer with the same configuration but no WinRoute installed, 
everything is working fine.

I did not found any bug related to that particular configuration in the bug 
database and either in various apache forums.

thanks
patt
creator: patt_reveur@hotmail.com

text:
Created attachment 3937
Error log (see child.c updated with more log lines)
creator: patt_reveur@hotmail.com
patt_reveur@hotmail.com
text:
Created attachment 3938
child.c with more info lines (see error log accordingly)

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Well, XP/Winroute is also incompatible with Apache [see bug 8325, bug 13083, 
  and even bug 7932 for examples of products that decided not to follow the
  WinSock2 API, or implemented it incompletely.]

  As stated in those reports, we don't have source code to this product, so
  we can't venture to guess what they did wrong.  However, expect a fix soon
  to the looping/100% cpu utilization problem when one of these bugs is 
  encountered.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 8325 ***
